hackathon-description-text: SpartaHack is Michigan State University’s official hackathon. For one weekend, 300 students from a wide range of disciplines and skill levels will team up to build creative, innovative technological projects from scratch.
hackathon-eligibility:
- Teams can have a maximum of 4 members
- All team members must be registered attendees of SpartaHack
- All members must be physically present at SpartaHack
hackathon-requirements:
You MUST fill out
Submissions must contain the following:
hackathon-rules:
- Each team is permitted one submission
- Submission must be received by 8:30am on Sunday, March 29th, 2015
- Code submitted for judging must be produced only by team members and written during SpartaHack
By submitting a project, you and your team grant the SpartaHack team the unrestricted right to use your submission material, at no cost, for promotional purposes of future SpartaHack events.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $1,000 + 1 year Treehouse subscription + Dell tablets + Admission to Global Hackathon: Seoul
$750 + 6 month Treehouse subscription
$500 + 3 month Treehouse subscription
$250 for the best iOS hack
$250 for the best Android hack
$250 for the best web hack
$250 for hack with best user experience
$250 for most technically impressive hack
$250 for best hack created by a team of first-time hackathon attendees
$250 for funniest or most creative hack
Nexus Player for hack with best use of a Google API
Assortment of Star Wars and Lord of the Rings Lego Sets for best hack using the PayPal, Braintree, or Venmo API
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most Innovative Use of PayPal/Braintree/Venmo API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $500 for best hack involving an optimization solution (process or logistics)
Myo armbands (for each team member) for the best hack involving the Myo armband
1st Place: Firebase Trophy and 6 months of Firebase Blaze Plan ---
External hard drives (for each team member) for the best hack that uses AWS
Automatic finalist position for KPCB Fellows 2015
$300 for hack with best business potential
1st Place: Pick one each from 4 Kitchen-Aid Blenders, 4 Kitchen-Aid Personal Coffee Makers, and 4 EveryDrop Water Filter --- 2nd Place:  Pick one each from remaining ---
3 x Parrot Sumo MiniDrones

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
(1) The presentation of the project ---
(2) The originality of the idea ---
(3) The algorithm that they created and/or API utilization

(1) Utilization of API’s and hardware technologies ---
(2) Implemented complex algorithms ---
(3) Integrated across multiple platforms

(1) Very straightforward and natural adoption of the interface ---
(2) The design work is well executed and there was thought about the user in the implementation

(1) The team challenged themselves to learn something new ---
(2) The team management was well organized and executed ---
(3) The project is working and can be well demonstrated
